page.title: 01WELCOME TO EDENBRIDGE
page.content: Edenbridge is a small market town situated in the heart of a farming belt about 30 miles from London. The population at present is about eight thousand. Many of the residents commute to London, but there is also a large industrial estate employing a great many adults. The actual population increased greatly in the early 1960's when a council estate, Spitals Cross, was built to house residents moving down from London. The town centre is full of character mainly because the buildings appear to have been thrown together with little thought of planning or architectural style. The shops are concentrated in a ribbon development of about 300 metres. Clubs and sports are well supported in the town paricularly since the opening of the Leisure Centre in 1984.
